CALLING ALL CONSERVATIVES WITH A CAN-DO ATTITUDE!
I'm running for President of the United States.
Thank you, God bless you, and God bless the United States of America.
The final verdict on our generation will be written by Americans not yet born. Let us make sure they record that we made the right choice.
But if we fail, they will be the first generation of Americans to inherit a country worse off than the one left for their parents.
If we can capture the promise of this new century they will be the freest and most prosperous Americans ever.
But I have chosen this course because this election is about them. Theirs is the most important generation in American history.
That journey, from behind that bar to behind this podium, is the essence of the American Dream.
My father stood behind a small portable bar in the back of a room...so that tonight I could stand behind this podium in front of this room
Because I believe our very identity as an exceptional nation is at stake, and I can make a difference as President.
I have heard some suggest that I should step aside and wait my turn. But I cannot.
...as those who come from power and privilege.
I live in an exceptional country where even the son of a bartender and a maid can have the same dreams and the same future...
... I announce my candidacy for President of the United States of America.
That is why today, grounded by the lessons of our history, and inspired by the promise of our future...
But yesterday is over, and we are never going back.
Just yesterday, a leader from yesterday began a campaign for President by promising to take us back to yesterday.
This election is not just about what laws we will pass. It is a generational choice about what kind of country we will be.

Today I released my foreign policy doctrine.
And because we will, the 21st century will be another American Century
And I believe America will continue to advance the cause of peace and freedom in our time.
I believe America still has that genius.
Only American leadership will bring safety and enduring peace.
Protecting our people and their interests  ,  is the highest honor, the greatest burden, and the most profound privilege
It will reestablish a foreign policy based on strategy and principle rather than politics and polls.
Those are the 3 pillars of my doctrine - American Strength, the protection of our global economy & proud advocacy for America’s core values
In this century, we must restore America’s willingness to think big — to state boldly what we stand for and why it is right.
America is the first power in history motivated by a desire to expand freedom rather than its own territory.
We must recognize that our nation is a global leader not just because it has superior arms, but because it has superior aims.
I will use American power to oppose any violations of international waters, airspace, cyberspace, or outer space.
Now, in the 21st century, you can access global markets in a single second, with a tap on your smartphone.
So to restore American Strength, my first priority will be to adequately fund our military.
This is an idea that stems from a simple truth: the world is at its safest when America is at its strongest.
The stakes of tomorrow are too high to look to the failed leadership of yesterday.
… a leader from yesterday whose tenure as Secretary of State was ineffective at best and dangerously negligent at worst.

Read why the President should sign this bill protecting girls
In the years ahead, it is my hope that each side will respect the dignity of the other.
...and a large number of Americans will be pleased with the Court’s decision today.
A large number of Americans will continue to believe in traditional marriage....
...and millions of Americans whose faiths hold a traditional view of marriage.
The next president and all in public office must strive to protect the First Amendment rights of religious institutions...
While I disagree with this decision, we live in a republic and must abide by the law.
This decision short-circuits the political process that has been underway on the state level for years.
That is the right of our people, not the right of the unelected judges or justices of the Supreme Court.
People who disagree with the traditional definition of marriage have the right to change their state laws.
...and should be between one man and one woman.
I believe that marriage, as the key to strong family life, is the most important institution in our society...
